p: In the last 100 days, the global pandemic of COVID-19 has so far infected more than 3 million people worldwide and led to the death of over 200,000. Many countries are under a lockdown of some form. This has caused severe disruption with devastating social, economic, and health care consequences. Countries are struggling to find ways to get back to the normalcy of some degree and are preparing for the next wave of infection to impact in the fall and winter of 2020.
